alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 26 at 2:12PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...The Yukon and Porcupine River * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Water levels are running bankfull and overbank in low lying areas and minor flooding is possible. Remote cabins and fish camps along may experience minor flooding and significant bank erosion is likely. Flooding is more significant in Fort Yukon and Stevens Village. See the current Flood Warnings for additional details. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rapid snowmelt has pushed a large volume of water down tributaries feeding the Yukon and Porcupine River. This high water will continue to move down the Yukon River over the next several days. Water levels on the Yukon River at Dawson City and Eagle have crested and going down. Water levels will remain high through the weekend and begin to recede early next week. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc If you live near or along the Yukon or the Porcupine River, you are encouraged to move valuables to higher ground, and prepare to move yourself to higher ground at short notice.
info.instruction: You should monitor water levels and prepare to move to higher ground should flooding get worse. Those living in areas prone to flooding should take action now and move valuables to higher ground.
